[96] Ritual Supplement GENERAL Two printings of the key ritual have been made. Same of the instructions contained herein will not be necessary when using the books printed after the first printing as the corrections or additions may have been made previously, lit is emphasized that these instruc - tions are to be considered in conjunction with the key ritual it supplements and it is not intended that this will in any way change the nitualiastic ward. Indicated below are instructions which are applicable generally and do not refer specifically to a particular Line: The WM uncovers whenever pronouncing the name of Deity. Singular or plural forms of wards should be used as the situation would dictate to be grammatically correct. Particular attention should be paid to the passage to which the VSL should be opened: EA — Psalms 133; FC — Amos 7:7-8; MM — Ecciesiastes 12:1-7. When door is being tyled by JD, it is always by 3 - 3 - I - 1. When being opened either by T or JD, it is by 3 - 3. Knocks should always be deliberate to indi - cate meaning and purpose; never rushed, uneven or careless. Deacons and Stewards should stand before taking rods. floor work rods should be carried in right hand. While standing, rods should be held with end against the outside of the right toe, forearm at 900 angle to upper arm and rod slanted forward at slight angle. When starting to walk, position of hand on rod should not be changed; rod should be tucked under arm at an angle — not straight up and dawn nor straight out. While standing, never lean on rods or give impression they are being used as support. When Deacons and Stewards leave their places, they should carry nods; except dur - ing the opening and closing ceremonies of receiving and returning jewels or during same special occasion where it would be impassible to carry them. In any instance, when conducting candidate, the SD turns to the right; when recanducting candidate, SD turns to the left. SD should take candidate’s right arm in his left hand. When arriving at various stations, SD should release candidate’s arm before making alarm. When retiring from altar after obligation, wardens, after slight bow to WM, retire to stations at same time as WM. When presenting anyone at the altar, the SD should say “WM, I have the honor to introduce to you .. He should not say “I have the honor to introduce to you and through you to the brethren.” The column of the SW should be up while lodge is in session; down when the lodge has been called from labor to refreshment on free from restraint. The col - uma of the JW is down while lodge is in session; up when the column of the SW is down. Both down when lodge is closed. Flag presentation. WM should ask “all citizens of the United States join with me in the pledge of allegiance to the Flag of our Country.” When WM desires the —2— k ——I . Flag presented at the A, it should be done by the M. The Flag may be placed in stand next to M’s chair or in the stand in the East prior to presentation at A. When being held at the A, it should never dip so that it touches the A or the GLs. After the pledge, the WM instructs the M to place the Flag in its proper position in the F When WM does not desire the Flag presented at the A, it should be placed in the stand in the F and the pledge should be given xvhile Flag is in place Jewels of all officers are transferred to occupant temporarily replacing occupant of any station. STATED MEETING When individual Lodge By-Laws do not dictate otherwise, following will be the regular order of busi - ness at a Stated Meeting. This foLlows ritualistic opening of Third Degree. 1. If Flag ceremony or pledge of allegiance to Flag of the United States not given before W.M. de - clares Lodge open, it should be done at this time. 2. Introductions of distinguished guests and/ar members. 3. Conduct proficiency examinations or have com - mittee report when proficiency is given at same time other than in open lodge. 4. Reading of the Minutes. W.M. Brethren, this being our stated meeting for the month of , the first order of business will be the reading of the min - utes of our last stated and subsequent spe - cial meetings. Bra.
